description: Clinical WGS for rare disease diagnosis. Calls SNVs, indels, SVs, and CNVs with comprehensive annotation and pathogenicity scoring for single probands.
content:
Rare Disease Diagnostic Sequencing

Clinical-grade WGS analysis for rare disease diagnosis in single patients (singletons). Identifies causal variants for Mendelian disorders with comprehensive variant annotation and pathogenicity scoring.

Why WGS for Rare Disease?

  • Diagnostic Yield: 25-50% solve rate for rare diseases
  • Comprehensive Coverage: Exons + introns + regulatory regions
  • All Variant Types: SNVs, indels, SVs, CNVs, repeat expansions
  • No Bias: Detect variants in any gene
  • Re-analysis: Data reusable as new genes discovered
  • Structural Variants: ~10% of diagnoses missed by WES

Clinical Applications

  • Undiagnosed Diseases: Patients with unknown genetic etiology
  • Mendelian Disorders: Autosomal dominant/recessive, X-linked
  • Pediatric Genetics: Developmental disorders, intellectual disability
  • Neurology: Epilepsy, ataxia, neuropathy
  • Metabolic Disorders: Inborn errors of metabolism
  • Multi-System Disorders: Complex phenotypes

Variant Detection

  • SNVs & Indels: DeepVariant (Google) for high accuracy
  • Structural Variants: Manta, TIDDIT for large SVs
  • Copy Number Variants: GATK-gCNV for dosage changes
  • Mitochondrial Variants: mtDNA heteroplasmy detection
  • Repeat Expansions: ExpansionHunter for STR diseases

Annotation & Prioritization

Databases: ClinVar, OMIM, HGMD, gnomAD

Prediction Tools: CADD, REVEL, SpliceAI, PolyPhen-2

Gene-Phenotype Matching: HPO phenotype matching

Inheritance Models: AR, AD, XL, de novo

Filtering: Population frequency, quality, inheritance

Singleton Analysis

For single probands without family members:

  • De Novo Variants: Look for new dominant mutations
  • Homozygous Variants: Recessive disease candidates
  • Compound Heterozygotes: Two variants in same gene
  • X-Linked: Hemizygous in males
  • Dominant Pathogenic: Known disease variants

Clinical Workflow

  1. Sequencing: 30-40X coverage WGS
  2. Variant Calling: All variant types detected
  3. Annotation: Pathogenicity and clinical relevance
  4. Filtering: Rare, predicted pathogenic
  5. Phenotype Matching: Gene-disease associations
  6. Validation: Sanger sequencing of candidates
  7. Clinical Report: Diagnostic findings

Input Requirements

CSV samplesheet with columns:

  • sample: Unique sample ID
  • lane: Sequencing lane
  • fastq_1, fastq_2: Paired-end reads
  • sex: 1 (male), 2 (female), 0 (unknown)
  • phenotype: 2 (affected)
  • case_id: Case/family identifier

Key Outputs

  • Annotated VCF: All variants with pathogenicity scores
  • Filtered VCF: Candidate diagnostic variants
  • SV VCF: Structural variants
  • CNV VCF: Copy number variants
  • Gene Ranking: Prioritized candidate genes
  • Clinical Report: Diagnostic interpretation

Perfect for: Rare disease diagnosis • Undiagnosed patients • Clinical WGS • Mendelian disorders • Pediatric genetics
